title: Nazarene Schools
description:
Nazarene schools are Christian educational institutions affiliated with the Church of the Nazarene, a Protestant denomination in the Wesleyan-Holiness tradition. These schools integrate biblical teaching and Christian values throughout their academic programs.

Key characteristics of Nazarene schools:

• Emphasis on Wesleyan-Holiness theology and holy living
• Bible-based curriculum with daily scripture study and chapel services
• Focus on character development and Christian service
• Commitment to academic excellence alongside spiritual formation
• Typically smaller class sizes with individualized attention
• Strong sense of community and family involvement

The Church of the Nazarene emphasizes personal holiness, compassion, and service to others. Schools in this tradition often incorporate service-learning projects and mission opportunities into their programs.

Many Nazarene schools in Florida participate in state scholarship programs including FES-UA (for students with unique abilities), FTC, and FES-EO, making private Christian education more accessible to families.

When considering a Nazarene school, ask about their statement of faith, how biblical teaching is integrated into daily instruction, and their approach to serving students with different learning needs.
